resources.string: Draculas castle (Bran Castle) was the home of Vlad Tepes a.k.a. Count Dracula.\nVlad(1428-1476) was voivode (or prince) of Wallachia three times between 1448 and his death.\nHe became to be known as Count Dracula from Bram Stoker\'s book called \'Dracula\' published in 1897.

From Bucharest, head north on DN1/E60, pass by Ploiesti, continue to follow DN1/E60, after Azuga turn left on DN73A, at Rasnov turn left onto DN73/E574, drive 10KMs and Bran Castle will be on the left.
